info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:14AM CDT until June 17 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT FOR MADISON AND MACOUPIN COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...CENTRAL ST. CHARLES AND ST. LOUIS COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND ST. LOUIS CITY... At 513 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Palmyra to 6 miles northwest of Carlinville to near Jerseyville to near Portage Des Sioux, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...The automated station at Lambert Field reported a wind gust of 60 mph at 957 AM. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Carlinville, Palmyra, Virden, Girard, Alton, Wood River, East Alton, Bunker Hill, Hartford, Bethalto, South Roxana, Roxana, Rosewood Heights, Staunton, Gillespie, Wilsonville, Mount Clare, East Gillespie, Dorsey, Edwardsville, Benld, Sawyerville, Eagarville, Prairietown, Glen Carbon, Mount Olive, Carpenter and Worden. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Castlewood State Park, Confluence State Park, Beaver Dam State Park, and Horseshoe Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 55 in Illinois between exits 23 and 44. Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 261 and 277. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 229 and 231. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
